title: Jake Matthews played it safe at UFC 243, but wants Carlos Condit next
text:
MELBOURNE, Australia – Jake Matthews beat Rostem Akman with a unanimous decision Saturday (Sunday locally) to close out the preliminary card at UFC 243 at Marvel Stadium in Melbourne, Australia.

Take a look inside the fight with Matthews, who got back in the win column in front of his home fans and has victories in four of his past five fights.

Result: Jake Matthews def. Rostem Akman via unanimous decision (30-27, 30-27, 30-27)

Updated records: Matthews (15-4 MMA, 8-4 UFC), Akman (6-2 MMA, 0-2 UFC)

Key stat: Matthews landed four times as many strikes as Akman, who hit just 14 percent of what he threw.

Matthews on the fight’s key moment

“The game plan was to take him down. I heard the announcer say he was a good striker, so I decided to strike with him. That’s how Aussies do it.”

Matthews on fans thinking he played it safe

“It’s hard for the fans to understand, but if he was a top-10 fighter, I would have swung for the fences. This was a very dangerous fight for me. He’s a relative newcomer and I’ve been here for 12 fights. I had to show that maturity and experience. I felt completely in control. Most of my fights are a blur, but this one I was aware of everything going on. I’m very happy with that. I got the win, which is the main thing.”

Matthews on what he wants next

“I asked for Carlos Condit this fight, but I know he’s fighting Mickey Gall next. So once Carlos is done smashing Mickey, I’d like to have that legend fight.”
